timeline.bodyText: you can move this into the try block - then you don't need the privateTransaction variable
timeline.author: rain-on

timeline.bodyText:
nit: Could/shoud this take just a JsonRpcRequest - rather than the whole context?
Having said that this is a funny class - it takes Json input, and produces outputs business objects, just not sure what that means right now

timeline.bodyText: nit: is it worth moving this to the top of the function so you can use it for the JsonRpcErrorResponse (line 78)?
timeline.author: rain-on

timeline.bodyText: nit: any word if we need to validate on distribute? Seems better, but that said, its validity now does not reflect its validity when mined.
timeline.author: rain-on

replies.bodyText: Not sure. But it was doing validate before, I haven't changed this behaviour.
replies.author: jframe

timeline.bodyText: Is the API meant to return a hex string? Or a Base64 String? I suppose it depends - what goes into the PMT? Hex or Base64?
timeline.author: rain-on

replies.bodyText: It's base64 string in the PMT. Why this returns hex don't know, this is what is what already doing. Presumably because values are normally hex encoded in Ethereum RPCs.
replies.author: jframe

timeline.bodyText: is there a reason this isn't a function on privateTransaction?
timeline.author: rain-on

timeline.bodyText: wondering if this could be a more useful log msg if it included the transaction id (if such thing exists?)
timeline.author: rain-on

replies.bodyText: done. including the transaction hash on logs
replies.author: jframe
